And I'm Mary Louise Kelly Brett Kavanaugh Supreme Court nomination has not only divided the country it has divided the legal profession as senators move forward with a vote to confirm him more than Seventeen hundred law professors across the country are urging them not to do it

Sarah Stewart likes to think about what happens when planets collide she uses to actual
Cannons to simulate those massive impact here's one firing in her lab at UC Davis
Say three to one [noise]
Her work earned her a spot in this year's class of MacArthur fellows many of us call it the genius grant for years experts of thought the earth's moon formed after a large coalition knocked off a bunch of rock Stewart told me her research suggests a different story
During planet formation when two bodies collide there's so much energy released that most of these bodies are vaporized that means that a rocky planet like earth is mostly rock vapor what
Does rocket vapor and and what does it have to do with our moon
Rock paper is taking the rocks that we stand on end heating it up to the point where it becomes the gas
And when that occurs the earth becomes much larger because vapor is much less dense ... and it extends out into this enormous object hundreds of times larger than the earth today and we proposed that are men grows within the rock vapor of the earth after a giant impact
So the moon actually came from the earth
The moon grows within the rock vapor of the earth and that gives them in the same chemistry as the earth
How much of a revelation was that I mean how different was that from what scientists used to think about where the moon came from
It was hard to imagine that things could be so different and it was a mental roadblock to realize that giant impacts transformed a planet into an entirely new type of object and that could explain one of the biggest mysteries in the solar system
Did you have to overcome some mental road blocks of your own given what you would have been taught coming through academia
Absolutely and this is when we had a bona fide eureka moment to my graduate student and I are sitting in front of a computer looking at the calculations that we had done and realizing that all of the assumptions are actually violated by what we're looking at
I think in any field there's a degree to which people have to be taught to trust to themselves and maybe women even more than men are taught not to trust themselves was it difficult for you to have confidence that yeah ... I've demonstrated here actually
Is real scientists are terrified of being wrong [laughter] of course I didn't want to put something out there that was really a crazy idea and so we did have to convince ourselves first
How long did that take you to convince yourself
